title: Ticket #190: The procd on Win32 explodes in size and then becomes unresponsive
description:
Ben observed the procd on Win32 on an NMI build machine (a virtual machine) sitting at an image size of 500MB and not responding.

How the procd grew to this size, Ben cannot say.

Maybe this could be related to #42 ???
remarks:
2009-Feb-09 13:39:19 by gquinn:
It is not related to #42. It is an old bug fixed over a year ago: 

commit af879b04060cdf37a55ce75dd6bca97ef547495a
Author: gquinn <gquinn>
Date:   Tue Dec 11 15:57:08 2007 +0000

    Fix leak in ProcD on Windows caused by the performance counters returning
    information about two processes both with a PID of 0.

This fix happened in the 7.0 series of Condor. NMI is still running 6.9.3. As far as I know, the one environment-related big that was biting us in NMI has been fixed as of 7.2.0, so they should upgrade to avoid this ProcD bloat.
